    • Method Detail

      • fromString

        public static <T> T fromString(Class<T> returnType,
               String... strings)
        Converts given string into a value of given type, throwing an exception if conversion was unsuccessful. If the return type is an array, an array is returned. fromString(int[].class, "1", "2") => int[] {1,2} If no values are provided and the return type is an array, an empty array is returned. fromString(int[].class) => int[] {} If no values are provided and the return type is not an array, an exception appropriate to the conversion type is thrown. fromString(int.class) => NumberFormatException If the strings contains more than one value and the returnType is not an array, all but the first value are ignored. If the method cannot convert to the class specified, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        returnType - The class for the String input(s) to be converted to
        strings - the input(s) to be converted
        Returns:
        the converted value

      • splitString

        protected static List<String> splitString(String string)
        Helper method to split a string by case change or common delimiters. Multiple delimeters in a row are reduced to a single word boundry. Leading delimeters (a space at the beginning of the string) will cause an empty first word to be detected (bug?). Trailing delemeters do not cause empty words to be detected. Returned words are all lowercased.
        Parameters:
        string -
        Returns:
        the list of words detected in the string

      • toLabel

        public static String toLabel(String string)
        Converts the string to one suitable for use as "a label"? Splits string into words, joining it back together "In Title Case" with known ABBREVIATIONS replaced in all caps. If the first word of string is "is", that word is removed and a question mark is added to the end of the resulting string.
        Parameters:
        string -

      • toNormalized

        public static String toNormalized(CharSequence string)
        Normalizes a string, removing or replacing non-alphanumeric characters and lowercasing - Removes all accented characters. - Removes single quotes - Replaces non-alphanumeric characters remaining with a dash - Removes dashes Lowercases the result

      • fromCsv

        public static String[] fromCsv(String string)
        Splits the given string by commas, and returns each part unescaped. Calling toCsv(String...) on an array of Strings and then passing the result to this method will always return the same array as specified by the Arrays.equals() method.

      • toCsv

        public static String toCsv(String... strings)
        Converts an array of Strings to a single String in comma separated values format, escaping each string as necessary.

      • escapeJavaScript

        public static String escapeJavaScript(String string)
        Escapes the input string so that the resulting output can be used inside a JavaScript string AND none of the characters in the output need to be HTML escaped.
        Parameters:
        string -
        Returns:
        the escaped string, or null if the input was null This is not the same as HTML escaping a JavaScript escaped string, since the output can be used directly in a JavaScript string even when HTML-unescaping won't happen.
